snippet: Days after President François Hollande sternly told the United States to stop spying on its allies, Le Monde on Thursday disclosed that France has its own surveillance program.
abstract: French newspaper Le Monde, days after President Francois Hollande sternly told the United States to stop spying on its allies, discloses that France has its own large program of data collection; paper reveals surveillance program that sweeps up nearly all data transmissions, including telephone calls, e-mails and social media activity, coming and out of the country.
lead_paragraph: Days after President François Hollande sternly told the United States to stop spying on its allies, Le Monde on Thursday disclosed that France has its own surveillance program.

headline.main: France, Too, Is Sweeping Up Data, Newspaper Reveals
headline.print_headline: France, Too, Is Sweeping Up Data, Newspaper Reveals
